facts.text: Appellants sued for redemption and recovery of the suit lands alleging that Ex. A-1 dated March 26, 1900 and Ex. B-1 dated March 27, 1900 created usufructuary mortgages.

Respondents claimed that Ex. A-1 and B-1 were kanam-kuzhikanam transactions and they were entitled to fixing of tenure under s. 21 read with s. 3(15) of the Malabar Tenancy Act, 1929 (Madras Act 14 of 1930).
Trial Court upheld respondents' contention and dismissed the suit.
Kerala High Court affirmed the decree in A.S. No. 243 of 1955 on June 22, 1961.
Appellants appealed to Supreme Court by special leave.
During pendency of appeal, Kerala Land Reforms Act, 1963 (Act 1 of 1964) came into force; common case that appeal to be disposed under this Act.

Ex. A-1 and B-1 demised suit lands together with fruit-bearing coconut, arecanut and jack trees for 24 years; transfer for enjoyment of lands with standing trees and planting fruit-bearing trees thereon.
Kanam amount (kanartham) under Ex. A-1 was Rs. 5,000/- and under Ex. B-1 was Rs. 600/-.

Transferees entitled to appropriate income of lands in lieu of interest on kanam amounts and to hold lands even after expiry of 24 years until payment of kanam amounts and value of trees planted by them.
Ex. A-1 styled as kanam deed in Kettiyadakkam kanam right; Ex. B-1 explicitly stated demises under Ex. A-1 and B-1 were in kanam-kuzhikanam right.
Subsequent documents Exs. B-2, B-5, B-8, B-9, B-10 (1921-1944) recited Exs. A-1 and B-1 as kanam-kuzhikanam transactions.

Exs. A-1 and B-1 did not contain any recital showing they created security for repayment of a debt; parties did not describe as mortgage, otti, panayam or kyvasam panayam, but as kanam-kuzhikanam with kanartham.

legal_issues.text: Whether Ex. A-1 dated March 26, 1900 and Ex. B-1 dated March 27, 1900 were kanam-kuzhikanam transactions, or whether they created usufructuary mortgages.
Whether respondents are holders of kanam-kuzhikanam within the meaning of s. 2(23) of Kerala Land Reforms Act, 1963.

petitioner_arguments.text: Exs. A-1 and B-1 created usufructuary mortgages.

respondent_arguments.text: Exs. A-1 and B-1 were kanam-kuzhikanam transactions entitling them to fixity of tenure under relevant tenancy laws.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: s. 21 read with s. 3(15) of Malabar Tenancy Act, 1929; s. 2(23) of Kerala Land Reforms Act, 1963

court_reasoning.text: All conditions of kanam-kuzhikanam in main part of s. 2(23) of Kerala Land Reforms Act, 1963 satisfied, but proviso excludes usufructuary mortgage as defined in s. 58(d) TPA.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Kanam-kuzhikanam is a lease for enjoyment; mortgage secures debt.

court_reasoning.text: Name given by parties relevant; both Exs. A-1 and B-1 styled kanam deeds, B-1 explicitly kanam-kuzhikanam; no mortgage recitals.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Documents read together show kanam-kuzhikanam; subsequent docs confirm.

court_reasoning.text: Transactions not for securing debts; agree with courts below that they were kanam-kuzhikanam and not usufructuary mortgages.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Full effect to document tenor as lease under s. 12 of Act.

holdings.text: Exs. A-1 and B-1 were kanam-kuzhikanam transactions and not usufructuary mortgages.

statutes_cited.name: Malabar Tenancy Act, 1929 (Madras Act 14 of 1930)
statutes_cited.relevance: Respondents claimed entitlement to fixing of tenure

statutes_cited.name: Kerala Land Reforms Act, 1963 (Act 1 of 1964)
statutes_cited.relevance: Governs disposal of appeal; defines tenant including kanam-kuzhikanamdar; gives fixity of tenure

statutes_cited.name: Transfer of Property Act, 1882 (Central Act 4 of 1882)
statutes_cited.relevance: Defines usufructuary mortgage, excluded by proviso to s. 2(23) of Kerala Land Reforms Act

outcome.summary: The appeal is dismissed; transactions held to be kanam-kuzhikanam entitling respondents to protections under Kerala Land Reforms Act, 1963.

key_quotes.text: A kanam-kuzhikanam is a lease, and is, therefore, a transfer of a right to enjoy the property. A mortgage is a transfer of an interest in the property for securing the repayment of a debt.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Distinguishes essential features of kanam-kuzhikanam from usufructuary mortgage

key_quotes.text: If the document purports to be or is, on its true construction, a kanam-kuzhikanam or other lease, s. 12 has no application and full effect must be given to the document according to its tenor.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Rules on interpretation of document as lease

key_quotes.text: We agree with the Courts below that the transactions were kanam-kuzhikanam and were not usufructuary mortgages.
key_quotes.speaker: court
